rComments: She is extremely dedicated to her students, which is what makes the class so effective, but at the same time, so very very difficult. Be prepared to work ALOT, but you will see huge results. 2 papers, 2 midterms, 1 final research paper, plus tons of extra homework/readings. She's adorable, too, and always made me smile!

Wonderful professor. She is so nice, and wants everyone to do well. You have to work hard in this class to get an A because there is a ton of homework, but she will be there to help you. The best Professor I have ever had!! And I learned sooo much Spanish from the T series.

Pagani teaches an experimental, 1st year Spanish series and it is the best way to learn this language at UCSC. She accommodates all learning styles in a small classroom setting and even teaches skills that you will be able to use outside of the classroom. You must work hard and she does take attendance seriously, but it is all time well spent.

Great teacher! A little tough but she is willing to help and work around your schedule. If you dont wanna work dont take her class, but if you really wanna learn interesting stuff and improve your spanish shes one of the best

Not only the most helpful and best teacher I've had, but also one of the kindest people I know. Her teaching style is very unique. No expensive textbook!($) I learned a lot of history through readings, as well as Spanish! I learned A LOT. Although there is a lot of work, it pays off in the end. HER DEDICATION IS AMAZING!! LOVE HER! TAKE HER!!

She is by far the best teacher I have ever had at UCSC. Her teaching skills go beyond being a good language instructor. She is 100% dedicated to her students,and this inspires her students to work hard.I learned so much spanish and history. The T series can be a bit challenging at times, and there s a lot of work, but it is completely worth it.

One of the few remaining profs that really cares about her students.  If you dont understand something she will sit with you as long as necessary until you do.  The class feels very comfortable and more like family than school. Viqui is genuinely interested in getting to know her students and in helping them learn something useful.

Viqui quite possibly is the best professor I have ever had in my academic career. While the course itself may prove to be challenging, ultimately it is worth taking because viqui has an insurmountable passion to really teach Spanish well. She is one of the few professors that strives to interact with her students and not simply react to them.

You can ignore any of those other negative comments.  I am in love with her! She is the cutest, hardworking and dedicated teacher.  She really goes out of her way to help you and truly wants you to succeed. teaches in a non-linear and an effective way. but you do have to put the work in.  She gives lots of papers but only because ther is no book.

She is by far the best Spanish professor at UCSC.  She is incredibly dedicated to her students and extremely knowledgeable-especially when it comes to teaching culture.  She uses innovative techniques such as online activities, music, film, history, and art to teach Spanish.  I highly recommend her.  She is the best there is!

WOW, i cant believe all of these bad comments. yes she gives lots of hw but it only helps u in the end and if u tell her ur struggling she is so COOL she takes time out of her day to meet with u. she is really cute, and funny she is a lively person and the BEST SPANISH teacher I ever had. She is really dedicate to u, but u have to be dedicated, too

I can't believe some of the negative comments I've read, because she is a wonderful teacher and person. Her class IS HARD! so don't sign up for her if you don't work. However, she will push you to work and you will LEARN something, speak better, and be proud of yourself for it. Her accent's not bad, and she is very understanding. Don't be a slacker

This class resulted in killing many trees.  T deadlines for homework weren't clear.  She gave ridiculous packets of papers, ordered arbitrarily with little to no explanation.  I was often snapped at for asking questions.  In the end, when we had to fill out evals she said something about the class being hard for her too and ran out crying.  umm yea
She is fabulous! She is very dedicated and willing to help each student. The only drawback is that she is very strict sometimes.

I took a class from Vicki about 7 years ago.I found her to be strict and not understanding about the fact that I was a pregnant student in my 2nd trimester. She even  made a totally innapropriate, offensive comment to me. I don't think she is enough of a people person to truly a good teacher.

She is a very nice lady.  She is also very helpful.  I enjoyed her class.  If you do the readings and participate in class, you won't have any difficulties.  Also, she doesn't have a strong accent.  Overall, the class was good.
Super hard class. She is kind of intense. Very intimidating. Her accent makes her hard to understand. A lot of reading in Spanish.
